projects.name: Saturn
projects.subtitle: Zero-Configuration AI Service Discovery
projects.description: Network service discovery framework using mDNS/DNS-SD to automatically connect applications to AI services on local networks. Eliminates manual API key configuration.

technical_details.protocol: _saturn._tcp.local. service type, TXT record metadata schema (models, capabilities, context window, cost tier, ephemeral auth)
technical_details.languages: 11 programming languages: Python (46%), TypeScript (14%), Lua (9%), Shell (6%), Go (6%), JS (6%), Rust (5%), C++ (4%), MDX, PowerShell, Makefile
packages: npm: ai-sdk-provider-saturn (4 versions, MIT license, Vercel AI SDK integration)
PyPI: saturn-ai v1.0.0 (zeroconf, FastAPI, uvicorn, pydantic; Python 3.10+)
technical_details.open_source: Open PR to Vercel AI SDK (vercel/ai#12495, 21.7K stars) — implements LanguageModelV3 and ProviderV3 interfaces, 169 lines added
technical_details.releases: 3 GitHub releases including cross-compiled MIPS router binaries

components: Python package: discover(), select_best_service(), SaturnDiscovery (background monitoring), SaturnAdvertiser (registration)
Proxy servers: OpenRouter (200+ models), Ollama (local inference with format translation), DeepInfra (scoped JWT)
Beacon system: ephemeral credential distribution without key sharing, automatic key rotation
TypeScript/JS SDK: Vercel AI SDK provider with circuit breaker, failover, health checks
Router deployment: OpenWrt UCI config, LuCI web interface, systemd integration, MIPS cross-compilation
CLI: saturn discover, saturn endpoint, saturn run, saturn config new
Clients: interactive chat, local proxy, 2 VLC media player extensions, Open WebUI pipe function
Failover: priority-based selection, health checks every 20s, circuit breaker (configurable threshold)
bullets: Designed mDNS/DNS-SD protocol (_saturn._tcp.local.) with TXT record metadata schema encoding model name, capabilities, context window, cost tier, and ephemeral auth tokens
Published saturn-ai on PyPI (Python 3.10+, FastAPI, Zeroconf) and ai-sdk-provider-saturn on npm (4 versions, Vercel AI SDK integration) — installable in two commands across both ecosystems
Built 3 proxy servers (OpenRouter for 200+ models, Ollama for local inference with format translation, DeepInfra with scoped JWT auth) exposing OpenAI-compatible REST endpoints with SSE streaming
Implemented circuit breaker failover with configurable thresholds, 20-second health check intervals, and priority-based service selection across discovered backends
Cross-compiled Go binary for MIPS routers with OpenWrt UCI configuration, LuCI web interface, and systemd service integration — deployed on GL.iNet hardware
Submitted PR to Vercel AI SDK (21.7K stars) implementing LanguageModelV3 and ProviderV3 interfaces for mDNS-based model discovery
Community posts on r/RASPBERRY_PI_PROJECTS and r/OpenWebUI reached 82K views and 70 upvotes

projects.name: OpenCode-Saturn
projects.subtitle: Saturn Integration into Open Source Coding Agent
projects.role: Fork maintainer, sole contributor of Saturn integration
projects.description: Integrated Saturn service discovery into OpenCode, a popular open-source AI coding agent. Enables the coding agent to automatically discover AI models on the network via mDNS — no API keys or manual configuration needed.

technical_details.scope: Modified provider system, event bus, session processor, UI sync layer
technical_details.features: registerDynamic/unregisterDynamic for runtime provider management, mDNS discovery server (mdns.ts), event bridging, failover logic
technical_details.fixes: LanguageModelV3 compatibility issues, Zod validation normalization

bullets: Integrated zero-configuration AI service discovery into OpenCode (103K stars), enabling automatic mDNS-based model registration with dynamic provider management and failover

Added Saturn provider to OpenCode: registerDynamic/unregisterDynamic for runtime provider management, mDNS discovery server, event bus bridging, and LanguageModelV3 compatibility fixes across provider, session, and transport layers

projects.name: Auto-Student
projects.subtitle: Academic Assignment Automation
projects.context: Teaching with Generative AI course, Adam Smith
projects.description: Canvas LMS-integrated tool that fetches university assignments, extracts content (HTML, YouTube transcripts, documents), and generates AI-powered solutions using a two-stage LLM pipeline. Built for research on generative AI in education.

technical_details.async: aiohttp, aiofiles, asyncio.gather for parallel processing
technical_details.apis: Canvas LMS API via canvasapi, OpenAI AsyncOpenAI client
technical_details.ui: CustomTkinter GUI with async event loop bridging, weighted progress tracking
technical_details.ethics: Built-in ethical safeguards: plagiarism warnings, academic integrity reminders

bullets: Built an async Python pipeline integrating Canvas LMS API and OpenAI API with two-stage LLM architecture (4B summarization + 27B generation) for automated academic content processing
Designed multi-format content extraction system processing HTML, YouTube transcripts, and documents in parallel using asyncio, as part of UCSC research on generative AI in education
Developed desktop application with CustomTkinter bridging synchronous UI events with concurrent async I/O via background event loop threading

projects.name: Language Driven Play
projects.subtitle: LLM Game-Playing Agents
projects.role: Primary contributor (team of 3, did majority of work)
projects.description: Comparative evaluation of LLM-based vs search-based game-playing agents in Slay the Spire. Demonstrated that Reverse Chain-of-Thought (RCoT) prompting outperforms Monte Carlo Tree Search for strategic card game play.

technical_details.agents: 6 agent architectures: RCoT, CoT, MCTS (UCT), Backtrack (depth-3 lookahead), Zero-shot, Random
technical_details.search: A* and Wave Function Collapse also implemented as part of game AI coursework evaluation
technical_details.models: Multi-provider LLM evaluation: GPT 4.1, Claude Sonnet 4.5, Gemini 2.5, OpenRouter auto
technical_details.api: OpenAI Responses API with structured outputs
technical_details.tools: GIGL (Grammar-based Intelligent Game Logic) for procedural card generation, MiniStS framework

key_results.rcot_vs_mcts: 42% higher average HP than MCTS in Tolerate scenario (50.6 vs 35.6)
key_results.finding: LLMs demonstrated superior semantic reasoning for interpreting novel card mechanics without retraining

bullets: Engineered LLM game-playing agents using Reverse Chain-of-Thought prompting and structured outputs, achieving 42% higher performance than Monte Carlo Tree Search across 5 evaluation scenarios
Built multi-provider LLM evaluation framework benchmarking GPT-4.1, Claude, and Gemini as game AI agents, extending published FDG '24 research on LLM-based General Game Playing

Designed comparative evaluation of 6 AI agent architectures (including A* and Wave Function Collapse) across 125+ simulations, demonstrating LLM semantic reasoning superiority over search-based agents for strategic foresight tasks
